meanings.definition: To go along with someone or something
meanings.sent1: I will accompany you to the store.
meanings.sent2: The dog will accompany us on our walk.
meanings.sent3: The friendly cat decided to accompany the group on their adventure.
meanings.sent4: The stars accompany the moon in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The colorful balloons accompany the cheerful parade.

meanings.definition: To provide musical support for a singer or musician
meanings.sent1: The pianist will accompany the singer during the performance.
meanings.sent2: The guitarist will accompany the band at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The trumpet decided to accompany the drums in a musical duet.
meanings.sent4: The violin's melody beautifully accompanies the orchestra.
meanings.sent5: The harmonica's tune perfectly accompanies the folk singer's voice.
